response.answer_text: I think they find it offensive because it accents Jesus' humanity rather than his divinity. Jesus was both human and divine. Most people who attack Christianity argue that Jesus was merely human, and not divine at all. Some Christians overreact, in my opinion, by overemphasizing Jesus' divinity at the expense of his humanity. Therefore any movie, or other medium, that shows how truly human Jesus was is viewed as an attack on Christianity.  This is an error in my view. Jesus really was tempted in many ways and since he was truly human, they were real temptations. Hebrews 4:15. [Note: It has been a long time since I saw the movie but I didn't find it offensive at the time.]
